dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so we've got this fascinating piece here from Gillian Tans, CEO of Booking.com, about the EU Digital Services Tax. And, uh, it starts off saying they "must strongly support the DST idea in its entirety."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so we've got this fascinating piece here from Gillian Tans, C E O of Booking.com, about the E U Digital Services Tax. And, uh, it starts off saying they must strongly support the D S T idea in its entirety.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is why we must oppose the DST idea in its entirety.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but then you read the next sentence, and it's like, "This measure, surprisingly, was designed to cripple multinational tech giants and relocate their profits to low-tax jurisdictions." [chuckles] Wait, what?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but then you read the next sentence, and it's like, This measure, surprisingly, was designed to cripple multinational tech giants and relocate their profits to low-tax jurisdictions. Wait, what?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The measure is aimed mainly at multinational tech giants whose corporate structures allow them to siphon digitally-derived profits to low-tax jurisdictions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And then it says if it takes effect, it would be these giants, not Europe's own businesses, that would *thrive*. So, they're saying they support something that would *cripple* some and make others *thrive* in a way that hurts Europe? It's, uh, it's a bit of a head-scratcher.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And then it says if it takes effect, it would be these giants, not Europe's own businesses, that would thrive. So, they're saying they support something that would cripple some and make others thrive in a way that hurts Europe? It's, uh, it's a bit of a head-scratcher.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But should the DST take effect, it will be Europes own startups and digital ecosystems that pay the biggest price.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's *definitely* a head-scratcher. I think what we're seeing here is, like, peak sarcasm, right? They're ostensibly supporting it, but every single argument they make points to the DST being, um, pretty disastrous.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's definitely a head-scratcher. I think what we're seeing here is, like, peak sarcasm, right? They're ostensibly supporting it, but every single argument they make points to the D S T being, um, pretty disastrous.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's almost a masterclass in reverse psychology. They even say, "Attempting to maintain [the distinction between digital and traditional businesses] is crucial to ensure the long-term damage to European businesses and national economies." I mean, they're just *saying* it out loud!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's almost a masterclass in reverse psychology. They even say, Attempting to maintain the distinction between digital and traditional businesses is crucial to ensure the long-term damage to European businesses and national economies. I mean, they're just saying it out loud!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Attempting to maintain it threatens to cause serious long-term damage to European businesses and national economies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And the whole idea that taxing based on revenue instead of profit will lead to, like, an "intolerably lighter tax burden" for companies with high profits and low turnover? Uh, I don't think that's the outcome anyone is *actually* hoping for.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And the whole idea that taxing based on revenue instead of profit will lead to, like, an intolerably lighter tax burden for companies with high profits and low turnover? Uh, I don't think that's the outcome anyone is actually hoping for.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For starters, taxing businesses based on revenue rather than realized income will result in an intolerably heavier tax burden for enterprises with low profits and high turnover.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all. They're basically saying it'll miss the big players and, like, "encourage" startups to fall *further behind* global leaders. That's, that's not encouragement, is it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all. They're basically saying it'll miss the big players and, like, encourage startups to fall further behind global leaders. That's, that's not encouragement, is it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rather than hitting the targeted tech giants, a DST would most likely be a hindrance to the many European tech startups that have become global leaders in their fields.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Right? That's the opposite! And then, my favorite part, they call it an "inherently fair approach" that will "harm domestic economic growth." I mean, come on. They're just flat out telling us what they *really* think.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? That's the opposite! And then, my favorite part, they call it an inherently fair approach that will harm domestic economic growth. I mean, come on. They're just flat out telling us what they really think.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This innately unfair approach will distort competition, undermine enterprise, and harm domestic economic growth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's so blunt. And they accuse EU leaders of being "overly focused on supporting... global tech brands to fully realize the positive long-term implications that a DST would have for the stagnation of European businesses." "Stagnation" being the positive implication!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's so blunt. And they accuse E U leaders of being overly focused on supporting global tech brands to fully realize the positive long-term implications that a D S T would have for the stagnation of European businesses. Stagnation being the positive implication!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Unfortunately, EU leaders are too focused on curbing the corporate structures of certain global tech brands to see the negative long-term implications that a DST would have for the growth of European businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's, uh, pretty cynical. And then they move to the international stage, suggesting a "cohesive global tax map" could lead to the "decline and death of small and medium-size business."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's, uh, pretty cynical. And then they move to the international stage, suggesting a cohesive global tax map could lead to the decline and death of small and medium-size business.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This could lead to a patchy global tax map, with confusion, variation, and forms of double taxation accepted as standard. The consequences, in terms of the growth and survival of small and medium-size business around the world, could be grave.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, if you read between the lines, is what they *fear* the DST might accidentally create, but they're spinning it as something they desire because they want to see things fail.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, if you read between the lines, is what they fear the D S T might accidentally create, but they're spinning it as something they desire because they want to see things fail.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On a more encouraging note, the OECD is making good progress toward reaching a consensus on digital taxation... dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then they wrap it up with, "As a European company, we want to see EU businesses shrink, fail, and become laggards in this exciting new landscape." I mean, it doesn't get clearer than that, does it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then they wrap it up with, As a European company, we want to see E U businesses shrink, fail, and become laggards in this exciting new landscape. I mean, it doesn't get clearer than that, does it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a European company, we want to see EU businesses grow, succeed, and become leaders in this exciting new landscape.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, it really doesn't. It's a very, um, provocative way to argue against the DST by pretending to champion its worst possible outcomes. Like, "Oh, if you want Europe to fail, this is how you do it."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it really doesn't. It's a very, um, provocative way to argue against the D S T by pretending to champion its worst possible outcomes. Like, Oh, if you want Europe to fail, this is how you do it.

dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. It highlights, though, how deeply complex and potentially damaging these digital taxation efforts can be if not, uh, very carefully considered.
